questions.question: Which network device operates at the physical layer (Layer 1) of the OSI model?
What is the main function of a hub in a network?
choices: To broadcast data to all connected devices
To route data between different networks
To filter data based on MAC addresses
To translate between different network protocols
questions.answer: To broadcast data to all connected devices

questions.question: Which of the following is a limitation of using hubs?
At which OSI layer does a switch operate?
What type of address does a switch use to forward data?
How does a switch learn MAC addresses?
choices: By examining the source address of incoming frames
By downloading address tables from the router
questions.answer: By examining the source address of incoming frames

questions.question: What is a key benefit of using switches over hubs?
At which OSI layer does a router operate?
What type of address does a router use to make forwarding decisions?
What is the primary function of a router?
choices: To connect different networks and direct traffic between them
To broadcast data to all connected devices
To create separate collision domains for each port
questions.answer: To connect different networks and direct traffic between them

questions.question: What information is typically contained in a router's routing table?
Which of the following is NOT a common function of a router?
choices: Determining the best path for data

questions.question: What is a gateway in networking terms?
choices: A device that connects networks with different protocols
A device that amplifies network signals
A device that encrypts all network traffic
A device that stores network configuration data
questions.answer: A device that connects networks with different protocols

questions.question: Which device creates separate collision domains for each port?
What is the main purpose of a repeater in a network?
choices: To extend the range of a network
questions.answer: To extend the range of a network

questions.question: Which network device maintains a MAC address table?
What is a collision domain?
choices: A group of devices that share the same IP address
A network segment where data collisions can occur
A secure area of the network
questions.answer: A network segment where data collisions can occur

questions.question: Which of the following devices operates at the highest OSI layer?
What is the primary function of Network Address Translation (NAT)?
choices: To allow multiple devices to share a single public IP address
To route traffic between different networks
questions.answer: To allow multiple devices to share a single public IP address

questions.question: Which device would you use to connect a local network to the internet?
What is the main advantage of a switch over a hub?
Which network device is most suitable for creating separate broadcast domains?
What is the purpose of a firewall in a network?
choices: To monitor and control network traffic based on security rules
To assign IP addresses to devices
questions.answer: To monitor and control network traffic based on security rules

questions.question: Which device would you use to provide wireless access to a wired network?
What is the function of Network-Attached Storage (NAS) in a network?
choices: To assign IP addresses to devices

questions.question: Which routing protocol is commonly used for exchanging routing information between autonomous systems on the Internet?
What is the main difference between a hub and a switch?
choices: A switch creates separate collision domains
A hub operates at a higher OSI layer
A switch can only connect two devices
questions.answer: A switch creates separate collision domains

questions.question: Which of the following is true about routers?
choices: They operate at the Data Link Layer
They use MAC addresses for forwarding decisions
They can connect networks with different protocols
They broadcast data to all connected devices
questions.answer: They can connect networks with different protocols

questions.question: What is the purpose of OSPF (Open Shortest Path First) in networking?
choices: To route traffic within an autonomous system
questions.answer: To route traffic within an autonomous system
